content.rendered:
Colorado is known as one of the best states in the nation for outdoor activities. Although many think of the steep deep powder in winter, Colorado's summers are truly world-renown. Colorado has everything from water sports to bike sports to camping. Some of the local favorites include rock climbing, horseback riding, fly fishing, ziplining and whitewater rafting. Once you begin to dig through these options there seems to be an overwhelming number of trip options but most can bundled where you can partake in multiple activities in one day. 

Some of the best multi-activity packages are some of the overnight packages that are offered such as our 24 Hours in Browns Canyon Deluxe. This overnight trip packages the full 16 miles of Browns Canyon whitewater rafting, secluded camping only accessible by water as well as one of the most extensive zipline courses in the state. Another popular trip combination will horseback riding and fly fishing, which can be fully accomplished right in Breckenridge.

For those looking into some hiking and biking, Summit County will be a great option. You can climb Mt. Quandary (14,265′ ft in elevation) in the morning and then jump on Keystone's world-famous “New Gravity” downhill biking course in the afternoon. Kremmling, Colorado is another great location full of activities. You are able to go out on an authentic cattle drive in the morning and off-road buggy tour in the afternoon, where you pilot both the trusty steed in morning and savage machine in the evening. 

For more information on the trips listed above or trips that you are interested in feel free to give us a call at 800-370-0581 or visit our website at ColoradoRafting.net. Although summer is coming to an end, don’t slouch and miss your chance to end your summer with a bang!
